points.title: Define user needs
points.summary: Understand your users and their needs. Develop knowledge of your users and what that means for your technology project or programme.

team-behaviours.description: The team conducts individual user interviews, not just presentations/consultations with groups.
The team has identified user personas or segments, preferably broken down by goal or activity rather than demographics

points.title: Make things accessible
points.summary: Make sure your technology, infrastructure and systems are accessible for users.

points.title: Be open and use open source
points.summary: Publish your code and use open source to improve transparency, flexibility and accountability.

points.title: Make use of open standards
points.summary: Build technology that uses open standards to ensure your technology works and communicates with other technology, and can easily be upgraded and expanded.

points.title: Use cloud first
points.summary: Use public cloud first as stated in the government’s cloud first policy.

points.title: Make things secure
points.summary: Keep systems and data safe with the appropriate level of security.

points.title: Make privacy integral
points.summary: Make sure citizens’ rights are protected by integrating privacy as an essential part of your system.

points.title: Share and reuse technology
points.summary: Promote good practice and avoid duplicated efforts by sharing and reusing services, data and software components.

points.title: Integrate and adapt technology
points.summary: Your technology should work with existing technologies, processes and infrastructure in your organisation, and adapt to future demands.

points.title: Make better use of data
points.summary: Consider how to minimise data collection and reuse data to avoid duplication of datasets.

points.title: Define your purchasing strategy
points.summary: Your purchasing strategy must show you’ve considered commercial and technology aspects, and contractual limitations.

points.title: Meet the Digital Service Standard for digital services
points.summary: If you are building a service as part of your technology project or programme you will also need to meet the Digital Service Standard.
